The Vile is ruptured and a set of Nanites begins to enter into Rockseeker to Paralyze him.

Nic <Proudwing500k@...> wrote:OOC: Can the owner of the vial post what happens to Rockseeker?

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
wrote:
> : : Lunekill : :
> 
> The ultra sonic sound was the first thing to get to Lunekill in 
this battle. She haults her attack and doubles over, covering her 
audio receptors with her hands...
> 
> 
> Jerame Johnson <jeramej@y...> wrote:
> New Hope: A Supersonic Scream is comming through the sky in the 
Maximals base. It is closing in fast. and Locking onto Lunekill and 
Fires. in a straffing Run targeting LuneKills Joints and then Flying 
Up into the sky and Transforming Into a robot and Comming down at 
her With a Cresent bladed Staff.
> 
> airly2000 <airly2002@h...> wrote: Windlord/Nighlight:
> 
> Windlord fired back while Nighlight ran toward the base.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
wrote:
> > : : Lunekill : :
> > 
> > Lune shrugs off Windlord's attack and continues her assualt on 
the 
> shields.
> > 
> > 
> > airly2000 <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > Nighlight/Windlord:
> > 
> > Nighlight looked worried towards the bas and she looked that 
> shields 
> > was falling
> > 
> > Windlordopened fire against Lune Kill hoping to stop her
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > : : Lunekill/Darkangel : :
> > > 
> > > Lunekill executes a roundhouse kick that takes Darkangel down, 
> > taking him out of action temporarily.
> > > 
> > > Lunekill: No problem, brother.
> > > 
> > > Lune opens all of her fire power on the shield.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > In the besieged Maximal base, the computers picked up nothing 
of 
> > the 
> > > crashing ship. However, Yggdrasil Prime's hyper perfectionned 
> > > electronics did pick it up.
> > > 
> > > Yggdrasil: Rodimus, if you got someone to spare, we got a 
mayday 
> > > signal from the other continent.
> > > 
> > > Rockseeker, however, was getting mad. Pulling out his pulse 
> pistol, 
> > > he pulled the trigger straight at...
> > > 
> > > The shield.
> > > 
> > > Soon, another 1% was taken away from the actual power, 
dropping 
> to 
> > a 
> > > total of 14%.
> > > 
> > > Rockseeker: Sister, you mind lending a gun? It'll take forever 
> with 
> > > that pistol!
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "shadowess_azogoth" 
> > > <shadowess_azogoth@y...> wrote:
> > > > OOC:  Well, looks like she'll have to wait until someone 
finds 
> > her. 
> > > > Pred or Max.  I guess Scrap happens at times. 
> > > > 
> > > > BIC:
> > > > She decided to kill time by using the scrap wires and metal 
> > outside 
> > > > the ship.  She managed to create a make-shift sensor beam.  
It 
> > > would 
> > > > surround the ship, but at only 15 feet away.  It was a foot 
off 
> > the 
> > > > ground. And it gave a soft hum, but she could barely hear 
it.  
> > With 
> > > a 
> > > > little luck, she had it run off solar power. The had to use 
one 
> > of 
> > > > her own small power cells to help store energy while the sun 
> was 
> > > > down.  Her own power levels ran at 75% on a full charge 
now.  
> BUt 
> > > she 
> > > > wasn't worried. So far, she had no clue other bots existed. 
And 
> > if 
> > > no 
> > > > other creatures were like the spindly legged thing she saw 
> > earlier, 
> > > > then she'd be fine.
> > > > 
> > > > Just on a sheer whim, she opened up her forarm scanners and 
> > > > radar. "Hmm, wonder if I'll pick up anything other than 
> > atmospheric 
> > > > interferrence."
> > > >

were 
> > > > defending their base from Unicron's Minions.
> > > > >

> thank

> > > > > StarFlier woke up to a dawn unlike she had ever seen.  The 
> sky 
> > > was

bot 
> > mode 
> > > > and 
> > > > > set about making her ship a little more livable.  She 
found 
> her 
> > > > small 
> > > > > tool kit and started working on fixing the emergency power 
> > cells, 
> > > > but 
> > > > > they were too far damaged.  She did find her distress 
> beacon.

> > > > > pressed it and hoped someday, someone might find her. It 
gave 
> > out

> > > > > general MAYDAY. But no allience signals. 
> > > > >

> > > outside

could 
> > > manage 
> > > > > was fixing her chair.  She sat in it and propped her feet 
up. 
> > She 
> > > > put 
> > > > > her hands behind her head and leaned back.  
> > > > > "Yeah, it won't be so bad here. A few curtains, a little 
> paint, 
> > > > this 
> > > > > might be down right cozy."  with sarcasm dripping off her
